Package fr.insalyon.hermes.client

Class HermesClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.insalyon.hermes.client.HermesClient
  • public class HermesClient
extends java.lang.Object
    This class allows users to interact with other users by connecting to the chat server

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void accessChat​(java.lang.String name)
      Allows asking the server to access a chat Access a chat mean get the history of all past messages
      void addUsers​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> users)
      Allows to ask the server to add a list of user in the current chat

      Allows to ask the server to ban a user from the current chat

      Allows you to close streams and terminate the connection with the server

      Allows to connect the client to the Hermes server.

      Allows to ask the server to create a chat

      Allows to ask the server the list of chat users The name of the chat is defined in parameter

      Allows you to know if you are using the terminal interface or the Kotlin desktop app

      Allows to ask the server to leave a chat
      void listenerThread​(java.io.BufferedReader inStream)
      Allows interpreting messages received by the client that have been sent by the server Allows to recover the different data received and to assign the appropriate application processing to make them interpretable by the user of the application The data will be stored in the various attributes provided for this purpose of the current HermesClient

      Allows to launch the application with the terminal interface

      Allows to send a disconnection message to the server
      void senderThread()
      Allows you to send different types of events to the server depending on the user's interaction with the application and its purpose Allows displaying data by the user in the terminal This thread is only used with the terminal interface by reading the System.in messages

                    int serverPort)
             throws java.io.IOException

        serverPort - server Port
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - risen if the server is disconnected

        Returns:
        true if the client is connected

      • listenerThread

        public void listenerThread​(java.io.BufferedReader inStream)
        Allows interpreting messages received by the client that have been sent by the server Allows to recover the different data received and to assign the appropriate application processing to make them interpretable by the user of the application The data will be stored in the various attributes provided for this purpose of the current HermesClient
        Parameters:
        inStream - the in stream of the client

        public void senderThread()
        Allows you to send different types of events to the server depending on the user's interaction with the application and its purpose Allows displaying data by the user in the terminal This thread is only used with the terminal interface by reading the System.in messages
